content: once there is a sizable amount of yarn single_crochet 10 st wrapped around the cardboard clip a round 24-25 single_crochet around 10 st long tail of yarn and tie it around the yarn round 26 5 double_crochet in next 5 single_crochet slip_stitch in next on one side of the cardboard this will be single_crochet leave the rest unworked the center of your pompom cut 8-inch tail and tie off work cut the yarn off the cardboard and fluff the ends trim excess such that the pompom looks full and fluffy arms make 2 round 1 magic_ring 6 stitches 6 st round 2 increase in each single_crochet 12 st assembly pictures to aid in the assembly are found on page 4 begin by attaching the muzzle to the head position the bottom of the muzzle at the 6th round from the bottom and centered between the eyes attach the ears to the head the 5 double_crochet that were done last should be positioned at the top of the head this allows the ears to flop down more easily attach the head to the top of the body you can attach this as firmly or loosely as you want i prefer a floppy stuffed animal so mine is looser 3 attach arms to the body pinch the end of each arm such that the opening is a flat line and attach to the body as such attach legs to bottom of body like you did with the ears position the 5 double_crochet to the outside of the body when attaching attach tail to back bottom area weave in all ends project complete 4 appendix abbrev stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet increase increase decrease decrease chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch magic_ring method the magic_ring method can be used in lieu of single crocheting into one stitch when beginning to crochet in the round it s a bit of an easier start and gives a smoother finish 1 create a loop with the yarn as shown in the figure below this is the magic loop 2 insert the crochet hook into the loop and pull the working yarn back through to create a loop around the hook pictured below pull the working yarn through the loop on the hook to form a chain stitch 3 insert the hook into the magic loop pull the working yarn through two loops on crochet hook pull the working yarn through both loops to form a single_crochet 5 4 repeat step 3 until you ve made the number of stitches needed the initial chain 1 does not count as a stitch 5 pull the end of the yarn to tighten the magic loop into a circle 6 finally use a slip_stitch in the first single_crochet to connect the round magic_ring complete 6
